title: Climate-Change Activism Has a Cost
sub_head: The flip side of environmentalist sanctimony? The West’s reliance on a ruthless autocrat to supply the energy it fails to produce for itself.
body:
For decades, the environmental lobby has, with no little sanctimony, owned up to its efforts to keep energy in the ground (“Biden’s Great Energy Contradiction,” Review & Outlook, March 26). It stalls gas pipelines, shuts down coal-fired plants, blocks oil production and organizes hostility to nuclear power.
Those same activists who dismissed the importance of energy security must now share ownership of the miseries resulting from energy insecurity, and from a war stemming in part from the West’s reliance on a ruthless autocrat to supply the energy it failed to produce for itself.
